Class Scheduler

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.Scheduler
public class Scheduler extends Object
Facade over a priority-driven scheduling algorithm for either a global or a local scheduler.

This component delegates priority computation to a pluggable PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm and attaches to either:

  • a processor-wide "global" scheduler via setParentProcessor(Processor), or
  • a per-core "local" (or single-core) scheduler via setParentCore(Core).

For dynamic-priority algorithms, calculatePriority(JobQueue) is used on each tick to recompute priorities. In that path the original priority is updated to reflect the current dynamic priority, inherited priorities override the current one, and suspended jobs are assigned Definition.Ohm.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • Scheduler

      public Scheduler()
      Creates an unconfigured scheduler facade with no algorithm and no parent set. Use setSchedAlgorithm(PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm) and either setParentProcessor(Processor) or setParentCore(Core) before use.

  • Method Details

    • calculatePriority

      public JobQueue calculatePriority(JobQueue jp)
      Recalculates the priority of jobs in the given job queue using a dynamic scheduling algorithm.

      Integrated behavior from inline comments:

      • Dynamic algorithms recompute priorities every time unit.
      • Each job's original priority is set to the newly computed current priority.
      • If a job has an inherited priority, it replaces the current priority.
      • Suspended jobs receive Definition.Ohm as their current priority.
      Only dynamic-priority algorithms should call this method.
      Parameters:
      jp - the JobQueue containing the jobs to update
      Returns:
      a new JobQueue whose jobs have updated priorities (inheritance and suspension applied)

    • setSchedAlgorithm

      public void setSchedAlgorithm(PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm a)
      Sets the scheduling algorithm that this facade delegates to.
      Parameters:
      a - the PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm implementation

    • setParentProcessor

      public void setParentProcessor(Processor p)
      Associates this scheduler with a processor as a global scheduler instance.
      Parameters:
      p - the Processor that owns this global scheduler

    • setParentCore

      public void setParentCore(Core c)
      Associates this scheduler with a core as a local (or single-core) scheduler instance.
      Parameters:
      c - the Core that owns this local scheduler

    • getSchedAlgorithm

      public PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm getSchedAlgorithm()
      Returns the configured scheduling algorithm.
      Returns:
      the PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm, or null if unset

    • getParentProcessor

      public Processor getParentProcessor()
      Returns the parent processor when acting as a global scheduler.
      Returns:
      the Processor parent, or null if not set

    • getParentCore

      public Core getParentCore()
      Returns the parent core when acting as a local/single-core scheduler.
      Returns:
      the Core parent, or null if not set
